Subject: Re: [junit] TDD compared to tradition development coupled with automated
 unit test generation
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864

J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Also, they tend to constrain me to the idea that each method should have 
> separate tests, and that makes future refactorings more annoying: it 
> couples too many tests to the implementation details of a class.

Do they do this by writing test for the private and package (default) 
access parts of the class? If so I'd agree that's brain-damaged. You 
should be able to change these parts of the class.

However, if the problem id that they're tying you too much to the public 
parts of a class, then I suspect that's an indication that too much of 
the class is public.

--
